items.a: Kimi creates separate workspaces with their own desktop files and windows. Each workspace is isolated from others.
Files are stored in C:\Kimi\Desktop1, Desktop2, etc. When you switch workspace, Windows shows files from the corresponding folder.
Kimi uses Windows Virtual Desktops. When you switch workspace, windows from other workspaces are hidden from taskbar.
Yes! Kimi doesn't hide or delete anything. If you close Kimi, click 'Reset' to restore your original desktop.
Yes, Kimi syncs with Windows Virtual Desktops. You can switch using Win+Ctrl+Left/Right too.
